result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan N. Cairns was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Walworth County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Pay $200 fine plus court costs including Department of Corrections Supervision Fees. Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT 
-------------------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
-------------------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence. 
-------------------------------------

No alcohol. No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No contact with victim(s) without victim's and Probation Agent's consent. 
-------------------------------------
AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations. Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. Defendant will not request early termination.

timeConds.notes:
Commencing on or before 5/13/2022 @8:00 am With Work Release.

Defendant shall report to the jail on time and with no detectable amount of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription, or defendant will forfeit Huber/work release for a period of 5 days, unless reinstated by the court. 
-------------------------------------

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bryan N. Cairns

records.addlTxt: Defendant Bryan N. Cairns appeared in court, Attorney Leah Selmek for Tony Kim for Bryan N. Cairns appeared in court. Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty to count 1. Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights filed. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges defendant guilty. Victim(s) have been given notice of hearing. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Defendant does not make statement. Court gives warning to deportation. Minutes filed.

Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Bryan N. Cairns appeared in court, Attorney Mackenzie Renner for Attorney Tony Kim appeared in court for Bryan N. Cairns. Defense is accepting offer but Attorney Kim is unavailable. Reset. Minutes filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Application for Jail Time Credit form

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Bryan N. Cairns appeared in court, Attorney Tony Kim appeared in court for Bryan N. Cairns. Minutes filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Bryan N. Cairns in court with attorney Tony Kim.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Bryan N. Cairns in court with attorney Tony Kim.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 8:34 a.m. Appearances made. Matter before the court for initial appearance. Record by Atty. Kim who has gone over charges, maximum penalties and enters not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. Court sets matter over for status. Court in recess. records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): A.C. OR HER RESIDENCE.  If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

21-5751 & 21-5752
Defendant Bryan N Cairns appeared in Court, in custody by video with Attorney Obi Uzowulu. James Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does qualify for SPD Attorney. Minutes filed.
